Title: Senior/Principal Survey Analyst
Description:
Principal Analyst, Scientific Research Group

Company Description

YouGov is an international research and data analytics group.

Our mission is to supply a continuous stream of accurate data and insight into what the world thinks so that companies, governments and institutions can better serve the people and communities that sustain them.

We have the best data and the best tools. We continuously challenge conventional approaches to research, and we disrupt our industry to ensure that our clients always get the best solutions.

We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics and proven methodologies. We trust each other and bring these values into everything that we do.

Each day, our highly engaged proprietary global panel of over 8 million people provides us with thousands of data points on consumer opinions, attitudes and behavior. We combine this continuous stream of data with our research expertise to provide insights that enable intelligent decision-making and informed conversations.

With operations in the UK, North America, Mainland Europe, the Nordics, the Middle East and Asia Pacific, YouGov has one of the world’s largest research networks.

Job Description

YouGov is looking for a technically sophisticated Principal Analyst to join the Analytics team within the Scientific Research Group. SRG is a fast growing unit within YouGov focusing on custom surveys and trackers in technology, politics, health, and other research areas with complex designs and client needs.

The Principal Analyst will report directly to the VP of Analytics, and in collaboration with the Directors, supporting the development of the Analytics roadmap and scaling the operation to meet our high growth targets. All analysts own client work, but the Principal Analyst will be heavily focused on development and innovation. We are looking for an individual combining practical experience in quantitative research with data science tools and best practices. Work in a fast-paced and intellectually stimulating environment where innovative solutions to market research, financial, and political problems are developed.

Responsibilities

Use background in stats and advanced analytics to act as a consultant with research teams on best analytic approach to research questionsUtilize data handling and warehousing skills to lead efforts to streamline the ingestion and processing of external data (ie population studies)Help grow our catalog of population studies and methodological toolkit through external data sources, academic literature, and internal researchIdentify opportunities to transform routine processes with automation and generalization, and lead these developmentsRecognize unmet needs of the organization and propose and lead projects or resources that fill themProvide mentorship to more junior team members, engaging them as needed in development and analytics projects


Requirements

Advanced degree (PhD or Masters) in statistics, data science, mathematics, computer science, political or social science (methods emphasis) OR equivalent experienceAt least 5 years of industry experience in data-centric role in quantitative researchStrong background in statistical modeling and machine learning methodsFluent in programming fundamentals, with advanced proficiency in at least one programming language (eg R, Python)Proficiency in R is required, with the ability to work inside and outside of the tidyverse frameworkExperience in the following technologies is desired: SQL, Git, LinuxExperience with cloud computing and data warehousing platforms like AWS or Snowflake are desiredA self motivated attitude, and the ability to look beyond established practices to find solutions to novel problemsTolerant of the ambiguity inherent in survey researchThrives in and promotes an intellectually diverse, collaborative, low ego culture


For roles based in New York, Colorado or Washington State, the base salary hiring range for this position is $90,000 to 125,000. Compensation offered will be determined by multiple factors including location, job-related knowledge, skills and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation and additional benefits. All US based full time employees are eligible for the following benefits: 

Paid vacation, holidays and sick daysFlexible working arrangements availableGroup medical, dental and vision insuranceCompany-paid life and disability insurancePaid parental leave401(k) with company match


While we are interested in the stated requirements, we recognize that qualified candidates may not check every box. If you feel this position would be a good fit for you, we encourage you to apply!

Company Description And Culture

YouGov is a global online research company, offering insight into what the world thinks. 

We speak daily to our panel of over 24 million registered members to understand opinion and behaviors around the world. We have a strong reputation as a source of accurate data and we’re trusted by the world’s biggest brands to get it right, making us the most quoted market research source in the world.

Why join YouGov?

Join our global team to help us achieve our social mission: to make millions of people’s opinions heard for the benefit of our local, national, and international communities.

Understanding diversity of opinion requires diversity of background. Although our global panel of millions of people worldwide powers our research, our biggest asset is our people. If our research is to be truly representative of what the world thinks, we need people from all walks of life to be part of the team to bring their perspective to the work we do.

Life at YouGov

We are driven by a set of shared values. We are fast, fearless, and innovative. We work diligently to get it right. We are guided by accuracy, ethics, and proven methodologies. We respect and trust each other, bringing these values into everything that we do.

We strive to provide YouGovers with best-in-class benefits to support their physical, financial, and emotional wellbeing. We want our employees to have a sense of belonging and uniqueness in a supportive workplace, so they can bring their full selves to work.

Equal Opportunity Employer

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity or expression, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, marital status, age, disability, genetic information, HIV status, political affiliation, socioeconomic background, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law or in line with our responsibilities as a fair and ethic employer. The Chick-fil-A Customer & Market Insights (CMI) team is the trusted source and strategic thought partner for consumer, Customer, and competitor insights. We are looking for an experienced research professional who is passionate about deeply understanding consumers and creating remarkable Customer-centric experiences. The Senior Customer Insights Lead candidate should be a confident and agile leader who can effectively create new research road-maps, learning plans as well as lead and consult on strategic insights design, analysis, & activation.

Our Flexible Future model offers a healthy mix of working in person and virtually, strengthening key elements of the Chick-fil-A culture by fostering collaboration and community.

Design and execute Customer research to understand expectations, needs, & preferences to shape the design and optimization of Customer/user focused delivery & digital offerings. Collaborate and build strong relationships with internal team members, digital agencies and third party delivery providers.  Lead relationship with delivery & UX research vendors, including budget management, scope alignment, and work prioritization. Your work days are brighter here.

At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.

About The Team

Research : We are a diverse and dynamic research organization, responsible for applying insights to influence design, product, and strategic business decisions. We’re passionate about crafting an outstanding research organization at Workday, known for delivering high quality, timely insights that help Workday deliver solutions that support thousands of employees around the world. Our team includes people from non-traditional research backgrounds, as well people from academia. We invite you to reach out and talk with us; we love research and researchers and genuinely celebrate the quirkiness that abounds across our diverse backgrounds - we’ve researched everything from authoritarian regimes to local food to software billions of people use every day. We’d love to add your research stories, too.

Productivity Technology: Our Productivity Technology team has the unique opportunity to develop the next generation of Workday’s foundational products supporting a customer base of more than 50 million. You will tackle challenging research problems and influence teams across Workday as you help create accessible, internationalized, and reliable software. Thrive in our people-first culture and do your best work. Join us as we change the way millions of people work!

As a Researcher at Workday you will work closely with your design and product partners for features in a particular product or area. Your research focus will be on both long and near term decisions. You will be empowered to help craft a research roadmap to ensure research efforts are aligned with priorities. Our ideal candidate is comfortable in at least one research method and can demonstrate ability in several others. We are looking for someone who can illustrate skills connecting research insights to business and product solutions. We are looking for a researcher with a consistent record of executing research projects and delivering on high quality, impactful insights. Building and maintaining strong, purposeful relationships with design, product, engineering, and research partners is crucial.

Areas of responsibility include:

Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify research questions and objectives.In partnership with design and product partners develop a research roadmap for a product or area that supports high priority efforts.Design and implement research using appropriate methods for the project, timelines, and business needs.Create durable research insights that align with user-centered design principles.Analyze data and findings to deliver actionable insights that inform business, product and design decisions.Socialize, collaborate, and present research work and findings to multiple teams and leaders, across the organization.

About You

Basic Qualifications: 

4+ years of professional experience conducting research 2+ years of research experience with a Master's degree in anthropology, sociology, psychology, human-computer interaction. Strong knowledge and understanding of evaluative, generative, quantitative and secondary research methods, and proficiency in at least one research methodology.Strong familiarity with the product development process.Ph.D. in anthropology, sociology, psychology, human-computer interaction (preferred) 

Other Qualifications:

Track record of translating research into business impact.Effective interpersonal skills with experience presenting to diverse audiences.A flexible and effective influencing style.Ability to meet bold timelines.Self-starter and strong finisher with a positive demeanor.Excellent collaborator, at ease partnering with other researchers, designers, product managers, and developers.Open to Flex-Hybrid reporting with 50% in our Boulder office.

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Description:
Who Are We?

Postman is the world’s leading API platform, used by more than 25 million developers and 500,000 organizations, including 98% of the Fortune 500. Postman is helping developers and professionals across the globe build the API-first world by simplifying each step of the API lifecycle and streamlining collaboration—enabling users to create better APIs, faster.

The company is headquartered in San Francisco and has an office in Bangalore, where it was founded. Postman is privately held, with funding from Battery Ventures, BOND, Coatue, CRV, Insight Partners, and Nexus Venture Partners. Learn more at postman.com or connect with Postman on Twitter via @getpostman.

P.S: We highly recommend reading The "API-First World" graphic novel to understand the bigger picture and our vision at Postman.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a Product Analyst to drive data-driven decision-making and deliver actionable insights that will contribute to accelerating and scaling the next stage of user and ARR growth for Postman. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze data, identify trends, and provide recommendations for product improvements. Your work will directly impact our product roadmap and overall user experience.

The position will be a key partner to help drive decision making in conjunction with cross functional teams, using the broad base of customer data available in our data warehouse(s). The person in this role will be expected to generate insights from the data on a proactive basis, while also being able to design and analyze experiments meant to better understand the motivations of a diverse customer base.

Ultimately, a successful person in this role will be expected to be a resident expert in their area of the business, and can work autonomously leading analytics efforts to encourage the team to improve the customer experience and metrics.

What You’ll Do

Data Analysis: Analyze large datasets to identify patterns, trends, and insights related to user behavior, product usage, and market trends.Reporting and Visualization: Create and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and communicate findings to stakeholders.A/B Testing: Plan and conduct A/B tests to assess the impact of product changes, and provide recommendations based on the results.Product Strategy: Collaborate with product managers to align data analysis with product development, helping to define and prioritize features and improvements.Data Quality: Ensure data accuracy and consistency, and work with relevant teams to resolve data quality issues.Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, design, marketing, and other teams to drive product improvements and optimize user experiences.Forecasting: Develop forecasting models to estimate future product performance and identify potential opportunities and challenges.Mentorship: Provide guidance and mentorship to junior analysts and contribute to building a strong data-driven culture within the organization.

About You

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics).4-6 years experience as a Product Analyst or similar role, with a focus on data analysis and product insights.Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R) and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).Strong understanding of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.Experience with web and mobile analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Amplitude) is a plus.Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.A passion for product development and a customer-focused mindset.Knowledge of machine learning and predictive modeling is a bonus.Prior knowledge of developer tools, with emphasis on API development (preferred).

Our Values

At Postman, we create with the same curiosity that we see in our users. We value transparency & honest communication about not only successes, but also failures. In our work, we focus on specific goals that add up to a larger vision. Our inclusive work culture ensures that everyone is valued equally as important pieces of our final product. We are dedicated to delivering the best products we can.

What Else?

This role is based in the greater San Francisco Bay area, and the reasonably estimated salary for this role ranges from $155,635 to $190,220, plus a competitive equity package. Actual compensation is based on the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition to our pay-on-performance philosophy, we offer a comprehensive set of benefits, including full medical coverage, flexible PTO, wellness reimbursement, and a monthly lunch stipend. Salaries will vary outside of the listed metropolitan areas & the U.S.

Equal Opportunity

Postman is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Postman does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Postman will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Postman.

About the organization:

People Strategy & Analytics is an emerging field where Capital One is on the leading front. Our team applies strategic thinking, advanced analytical techniques, and experimental research to uncover new insights and make informed decisions related to our most valuable assets: Capital One associates! The team is comprised of people with diverse skills and backgrounds including: data analysts and engineers, product managers, data scientists, consultants and strategists, business analysts, HR specialists, economists, and Industrial Organizational Psychologists.

As a Business Analysis Manager you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to solve open-ended, complex questions about how we should attract, develop, and retain top talent. You will work closely with HR partners and senior executives to shape talent policy, automate real-time data and improve talent decision-making. Your day-to-day might involve:

 Using data to help executives set ambitious but achievable diversity initiatives  Building models to predict attrition, and testing new retention strategies  Designing new ways to understand and measure associate potential  Developing analyses and tools to help Capital One source and hire the best talent 

…and you will do it all in a collaborative environment that promotes continuous learning, rewards innovation, and prioritizes your development.

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

 Strategy consultation: Partner with our clients to identify high impact opportunities to transform the associate experience, conduct analysis, and share insights that inform solutions  Design: Drive and build key programs and analytics solutions for our partners, including measurement strategy, attribution modeling, and automated insights  Experimentation: Partner with clients to design experiments to understand key drivers of associate behavior  Insights & analysis: Analyze the impact of our programs and combine those insights with the latest thinking in organizational science to help our clients make data-driven, informed decisions 

Successful Team Members Demonstrate Competencies In These Areas

 Purpose: You feel a deep personal connection to improving the associate experience and are motivated by applying advanced analytics in a mission-driven way  Analytical thinking: A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics.  Bachelor’s Degree  At least 2 years of experience in analysis

 Master’s Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering  At least 5 years of experience in analysis  At least 2 years of experience in consulting  At least 1 year of experience with SQL and Python

Title: Senior Researcher
Description:
M365 Research and the Privacy Preserving Machine Learning Initiative (PPML) are recruiting a Senior Researcher to explore privacy and confidentiality aspects of machine learning. The role offers the unique opportunity to work in close collaboration with colleagues in Microsoft Research (MSR), Azure Research, Microsoft 365 and other product groups. Our researchers pursue innovation in a range of scientific and technical disciplines to help solve complex challenges in diverse fields, including private and efficient AI, AIOps, and responsible AI, with applications to a wide range of business, consumer, and scientific domains.

We are seeking skilled candidates to explore various topics of PPML, including:

Privacy mitigations in machine learning, such as differentially private (DP) training, with an emphasis on Large Language Models (LLMs), Advancing approaches for synthetic data generation with privacy guarantees, Auditing privacy mitigations, Privacy attacks, including membership inference, poisoning attacks, and reconstruction attacks, Privacy vs fairness tensions in AI systems, Private and trustworthy grounding in retrieval-augmented systems, Novel applications of privacy-enhancing technologies (PETs), including but not limited to applications of DP, multi-party computation, and confidential computing. Federated Learning and analytics, Multi-party data collaboration 

We encourage researchers with relevant technical background in any of these topics to apply. This role is located in Redmond and is co-located with Microsoft Research.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities

The successful candidate will undertake cutting-edge research on privacy-preserving machine learning with a focus on natural language models, including the development of theory and experimentation. They will share their findings with product groups and the academic community via publications in recognized venues. Collaborations with other researchers, research interns, and product group partners across Microsoft are encouraged.

Qualifications

Required Qualifications:

Doctorate in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Statistics, Machine Learning or related fields.OR equivalent experience. Experience publishing as a lead or essential author in top conferences/journals in at least one of the following areas: machine learning, privacy, security, responsible AI, federated learning, natural language processing, computer vision.  
Preferred Qualifications

Background in machine learning and deep learning; experience with large language models and their applications in areas such as text generation, sentiment analysis, language translation, or conversational AI. Hands-on experience fine-tuning open-source LLMs also a plus. Familiarity with state-of-the-art practices and methodologies in security and privacy such as differential privacy, information flow control, secure multi-party computation, and homomorphic encryption. Track record in research, as evidenced by high-quality publications. Publications at leading NLP conferences such as NIPS, ICML, ICLR, EMNLP and ACL will also be an advantage. Software development skills and experience, preferably deep learning frameworks such as Python and PyTorch.

About The Job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

The Intelligence Analysis team synthesizes cross-Google intelligence, and prioritizes threats that could harm Google or its users. Analysts deliver actionable assessments to Google stakeholders to drive decision making, risk preparedness, and mitigation.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

Overview

Working at Atlassian

Atlassians can choose where they work – whether in an office, from home, or a combination of the two. That way, Atlassians have more control over supporting their family, personal goals, and other priorities. We can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.

This is a remote position. To help our teams work together effectively, this role requires you to be located in the Pacific Timezone.

Your future team

Our Design Operations team is a multi-disciplinary team focused on ensuring more effective designers and a more efficient Design organization. We operationalize and improve design practices, systems, and tools that drive craft excellence and efficiency – at scale.

We are looking for an experienced Design Operations Lead, AI to join our team to support! You will report to the Head of Design Operations.

Responsibilities

As Design Operations Lead, you will:

Lead as a strategic partner: You will understand the big picture and drive overall success, while tactically delivering incremental value for the team and the company. As an embedded DesignOps partner, you will partner with the Head of Design, Atlassian Intelligence, and their leadership team on org-level design initiatives. You will focus on leading operating cadences, and scaling practices that improve quality and effectiveness. You will be a "go-to" partner – always one step ahead, anticipating needs, identifying painpoints, and implementing solutions to enhance the effectiveness of design teams.

Bring strategy to action: Leading multiple workstreams, you will lead collaborative efforts to improve work management practices, instill effective team practices, and ensure alignment on a global change strategy. You will run complex -- often ambiguous -- programs. You will establish processes and governance and partner with Leads to provide clear guardrails while empowering teams to move quickly.

Title: Consumer Insights Manager
Description:
Overview

AARP is the nation’s largest nonprofit, nonpartisan organization dedicated to empowering people 50 and older to choose how they live as they age. With a nationwide presence, AARP strengthens communities and advocates for what matters most to the more than 100 million Americans 50-plus and their families health security, financial stability and personal fulfillment. AARP also produces the nation’s largest circulation publications AARP The Magazine and AARP Bulletin.

AARP’s Policy, Research and International Affairs leads the development and communication of AARP’s public policies and, research and insights on the issues that matter to people 50-plus.

The Consumer Insights Manager is responsible for conceptualizing, developing, and conducting primary and secondary research to generate valuable insights that shape departmental objectives. They evaluate programs and business priorities to identify areas for improvement and measure outcomes. Working closely with management, they identify opportunities to streamline consumer insights processes and develop new procedures that align with the needs of the business unit/department. Additionally, the Consumer Insights Manager takes the lead and collaborates on developing a research agenda to address critical questions and provide key data that supports the Association's priorities. This role specifically focuses on supporting AARP's Fun & Fulfillment strategy which includes events, entertainment, and social connection.

Responsibilities

Advises clients, stakeholders, and senior management on all phases of research, including conceptualization, recommendations for research methodology, and recommendations for action from research findings. Manages complex and conflicting relationships among multiple stakeholders. Represents Association’s research to external audiences including the media, legislators, and other organizations in venues including press conferences and professional meetings.Manages and collaborates on a major research portfolio with broad Association impact and synthesizes the complex array of data into clear, actionable insights. Develops and manages the overall research plan for the portfolio of work including specific project work plans, project budgets, requests for proposals, vendor selection and management of vendor work. Oversees the work of staff assigned to projects within the portfolio and provides direction, feedback, and contributions to staff performance reviews.Conceptualizes and designs complex research projects, including with high-risk or innovative methodologies and highly constrained timelines and resources. Selects the most appropriate data sources and collection methods to maximize the value and utility of the research across the organization, with the goal of building and aggregating a base of knowledge around key issues. Oversees vendors or supervises other staff who implement the data collection plan.Determines strategies for data analyses. Conducts and/or supervises data analyses including bivariate analysis, multivariate analysis, and other complex statistical techniques as required. Advises other research staff on statistical and data analytic issues.Communicates research findings, often from complex studies or from a program of research, by integrating related research and identifying implications of the research for action by decision-makers. Determines methods to communicate research results and works closely with others to develop clear, impactful deliverables for stakeholders including data visualization and graphics. Responds effectively to complex and challenging requests for clarification and elaboration of research results.Serves as an expert resource and is often responsible for work with high visibility and critical outcomes. Plays a role in managing knowledge resources by actively sharing knowledge, collaborating with others, synthesizing research to provide integration and context, and ensuring the maintenance of up-to-date research records that are accessible by others. Stays abreast of key news, policies, and consumer trends related to assigned core issue areas and research portfolio and applies that knowledge to proactively frame future research.Develops capacity by coaching and mentoring junior staff, participating in efforts to redesign workflow and systems, and providing peer review and technical assistance to other researchers.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Social Science or Marketing. Additionally, a minimum of 5 years of experience in applied research.A solid understanding of social science or marketing theories and principles.Proficiency in conducting both primary and secondary research to gather relevant data and insights.Ability to analyze research findings and develop actionable recommendations that inform policies, programs, strategies, or product development.Excellent consultation and communication skills to effectively convey research findings and recommendations to stakeholders.

Preferred

Master's degree in a social science, Marketing, or a Master's in Business Administration (MBA).Strong background in both quantitative and qualitative research methods and data analysis.Strategic consultation and insight generation skills.

AARP will not sponsor an employment visa for this position at this time.

Additional Requirements

Regular and reliable job attendanceEffective verbal and written communication skillsExhibit respect and understanding of others to maintain professional relationshipsIndependent judgement in evaluation options to make sound decisionsIn office/open office environment with the ability to work effectively surrounded by moderate noise

Flexible Work Arrangement (FWA)

AARP observes Mondays and Fridays as telecommuting workdays, except for essential functions. Remote work and telecommuting can only be done within the United States and its territories.

Compensation And Benefits

AARP offers a competitive compensation and benefits package including a 401(k); 100% company-funded pension plan; health, dental, and vision plans; life insurance; paid time off to include company and individual holidays, vacation, sick, caregiving, and parental leave; performance-based and peer-based recognition and tuition reimbursement. 

Equal Employment Opportunity

AARP is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. AARP does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, religion, sex, color, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, mental or physical disability, genetic information, veteran status, or on any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.

Creating a life you love also means finding a career that celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences that you bring. The mission of the Business Operations team is to assess how well Pinterest’s strategy is delivering enterprise performance and influence exec-level decisions to evolve strategy and operations accordingly. As the Director of Business Operations, Core, you will lead a data-driven team that drives critical business insights for our Exec Team while partnering with Product, Engineering, Marketing, Data Science, and others across Pinner Growth and Engagement, Shopping, and Content initiatives to improve how we execute. With a combination of exceptional analytical skills, insatiable curiosity, and strong leadership skills, you’ll help us better understand the Pinner experience and drive changes that shape the future of Pinterest.

What You’ll Do:

Own the rhythm for our “core” suite of investments across Pinner Growth and Engagement, Content, and Shopping. Partner with 2 VPs of Product to develop a deep understanding of how their product strategies contribute to Pinterest’s overall business success. Define KPIs for reporting, develop forward-looking forecasts and scenarios, and assess performance against goals to recommend strategy and operational improvements to drive business results.Be the primary point person with our leadership team on understanding metrics movements and trends in our consumer product, and provide data-driven insights on nascent business questions. Break down and solve ambiguous business problems and recommend solutions that inspire action from executives.Lead and mentor a high performing team of data analysts to become thought partners for cross functional stakeholders.


What We’re Looking For:

10+ years of experience, 2+ years of directly related experience as part of 5+ years of technology, finance, economics, or consulting experience in a fast-paced environment.Ability to operate full stack while also developing others. You can self-sufficiently conduct research, analyze data to ask and answer your own questions, visualize data in high signal-to-noise ways that make insights clear and compelling to executives, and create project structure and execution plans to drive swift action from those insights, while also mentoring growing more junior members of the team to eventually be able to do the same.Structured systems thinker who also loves the details. When engaging with a problem, you balance a focus on quick wins and actionability with ways to help Pinterest efficiently solve that problem at scale through systems and repeatable processes, and are comfortable diving into the operational details with the analytical, data, product, and engineering teams that you will be closely partnered with to make it happen.Strong communication and influence skills. You are comfortable partnering with a diverse set of cross-functional teams and synthesizing complex information for clear decision making and action by executives.

Title: Analyst, Trust and Safety, Modern Creators and Formats
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Seattle, WA, USA; Atlanta, GA, USA; Austin, TX, USA.Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.5 years of experience working with investigative tools or data analysis.4 years of experience in data analytics, Trust and Safety, policy, cybersecurity, or related fields.Experience with SQL, data analytics, and colaboratory.

Preferred qualifications:

Experience in product policy analysis and identifying policy risks.Experience in working with abuse, spam, fraud or malware.Experience using statistical analysis and hypothesis testing.Experience with AI, LLMs, Trust and Safety, or Cybersecurity.Excellent influencing skills, with the ability to work in a dynamic environment.

About The Job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

The Modern Creators and Formats (MCF) mission is to empower users to connect and contribute directly to Search. If Search is going to continue to meet the diverse needs of our users, we need to ensure that the web continues to grow with the right content.

Trust and Safety (T&S) is a team of user trust experts who think big and aim high to earn every user’s trust. We cultivate thought leadership, domain expertise, innovation and a cross-product perspective to help Google stay ahead of abuse and deliver trusted and safe experiences to all users.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $108,000-$158,000 + bonus + equity + benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities

Lead and manage multi- quarter, high-visibility trust projects (e.g., build critical trust protections to fight abuse in user generated content space, scale user base to key markets while meeting goal trust metrics). Analyze and debug escalations and identify trends that can indicate bigger product risks.Use technical acumen to drive project delivery, challenge proposals and identify risks. Manage multiple projects of moderate to high complexity and scope against crashed timelines. Collaborate with other teams and functions (e.g., Engineer, Program Manager, Legal, Policy).Drive usage and adoption of AI efforts for effective abuse fighting by identifying opportunities to reduce Operational Expenditure (OPEX), catch abuse faster or improve quality of decision making.Perform on-call responsibilities on a rotating basis, including weekend coverage as needed.

We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law.
